--- title: Client Configuration hiddenFromSearch: true --- 1. [Download](https://downloads.asperasoft.com/en/downloads/2) and install Aspera Client on your preferred OS of choice; Mac, Windows, Linux, by downloading and running through the installer with default settings. Note: Use the Aspera Icon to start the GUI on Mac and Windows. Run `asperascp` to start to GUI on Linux. 1. Start the Aspera Client and select `Connections` ![Connections](./images/configureNewProfile.png) 1. Select `+` to add a new Connection Profile for the Server ![Connections](./images/addNewConnection.png) 1. Complete the new Connection Profile form to add the connection to the server. - **Host**: DNS or IP Address of the Server - **User**: asp1 - **Password**: Use the password for asp1 user created when setting up the server - **Storage**: Leave as default as we have set up regular default storage on the server (/AsperaRootDir/asp1) - **Target Directory**: This is a path to go deeper into the root directory `/AsperaRootDir/asp1` ![Connections](./images/fillOutForm.png) 1. Click `Test Connection` and `OK` once connection is successful. If there are any issues please reach out to an IBM representative. 1. Select the Connection you just created and then click `Connect` ![Connections](./images/connectToServer.png) You can now drag and drop between filesystem panes in the GUI to upload and download files. During a file transfer you can select the transfer from the bottom pane to adjust realtime transfer rates and view session details. export default ({children}) =>
